src.scripts.quant module

src.scripts.quant.readThreshold(path, embryosquant, THRESHOLD)[source]

read intensity of maunally labeled pulsing pixels

calculate threshold value for each phenotype

assign threshold value to each embryo based on its phenotype

src.scripts.quant.reorder(nesteddict)[source]

Flip the order of a nested dictionary

Parameters

nesteddict (dict) – {ID0:{'x':x,'y':y}, ID1:{'x':x,'y':y}, ...}

Returns

{'x':{ID0:x,'ID1':x}, 'y':{ID0:y,'ID1':y}, ...}

Return type

dict

src.scripts.quant.selectEmbryo(embryos)[source]

Select embryos to quantify

embryos to quantify should satisfy the following conditions

  • green channel label is ROK

  • phenotype is not pfn

  • duration of image stack is longer than 130 seconds

Parameters

embryos (pandas.DataFrame) – all embryos

Returns

embryosquant – selected embryos

Return type

pandas.DataFrame

src.scripts.quant.stepExcitation(phenotype, ID, THRESHOLD)[source]

read binary mask of the outline of the embryo

use temporal derivative and threshold value to calculate binary mask of excitation and new excitation

src.scripts.quant.stepGroupDiff(phenotype, ID, run=True)[source]

read binary mask of the outline of the embryo

read raw 16-bit tif files

subtract photobleach trend in time for all pixels in each frame

calculate grouped average and derivative in time

src.scripts.quant.stepRaw(phenotype, ID)[source]

read raw 16-bit tif files

save as python dictionary for each embryo

export mean projection of green channel as tiff files

label outline of embryo in ImageJ manually and save as binary masks

src.scripts.quant.stepSummary(phenotype, ID, THRESHOLD)[source]

calculate summary statistics from binary masks of excitations and newexcitations

calculate average F-actin level in newexcitation pixels

calculate average autocorrelation of ROK level in all pixels in the embryo

src.scripts.quant.summary_exc(EXC, NEWEXC, outline, NMAX=100)[source]

calculate summary statistics from binary masks of excitations and newexcitations

Parameters

  • EXC (np.array((T,X,Y),dtype=bool)) – excitation mask

  • NEWEXC (np.array((T,X,Y),dtype=bool)) – new excitation mask

  • outline (np.array((X,Y),dtype=bool)) – mask of pixels in embryo

Returns

  • freq (1D array) – number of new excitations in every pixel

  • wait (1D array) – number of frames before next new excitation

  • speed (1D array) – distance from point to edge of new excitation regions

  • speedmsk (np.array((T,X,Y),dtype=np.float32)) – pixel value represents amplitude of edge propagation. pixels outside of embryo are labeled -1.

  • area (1D array) – largest cumulative are of linked excitation regions

src.scripts.quant.writeThreshold(path, embryosquant, result_grouped)[source]

calculate and write intensity of maunally labeled pulsing pixels
